bio:treatment.discussion: The large spores, capsule smooth above neck, and distinctly red peristome will separate Encalypta longicollis from similar species. The peristome appears single, but closer inspection shows endostome segments fused to the teeth. The spores are strongly granulate and much larger than those of other species in the genus. These characters will help also to place muticous-leaved forms of this species that resemble E. brevicollis or E. affinis.
